subject: Politics
title: Oil and Power
description: A micro-lesson that makes Oil and Power usable.

hook.text: The US invaded Iraq in 2003. Officials said it was about democracy. Critics said it was about oil. Both had a point.

buildup.text: Oil has shaped global politics for a century. Nations that control it wield enormous power.

discovery.text: The 1973 oil embargo by Arab states caused a global crisis. Oil prices quadrupled, and economies crashed.

twist.text: The US shale revolution changed everything. America went from oil importer to the world's top producer.

climax.text: Oil wealth often brings the 'resource curse.' Nigeria and Venezuela have vast oil but rampant poverty and corruption.

punchline.text: Oil is power, wealth, and curse all at once. It shapes who leads and who fights.

quiz.question: What is the 'resource curse'?
options: When resource wealth leads to corruption, poverty, and poor governance
When a country runs out of natural resources
When resources are evenly distributed across nations
